column4: Is there something "stronger" than rm -rf for removing files that seem to be corrupt?
how do you know it was corrupted ?
I'm guessing, the file attributes are all ?
nope, it indicates there's no user/group applied to it. Just use chown.
I did chown user:group filename etc and I got "Cannot access --- no such file or directory"
are you sure the file is actually there ?. Where is it ?
It's listed when I do ls -la
what was the output of ls -la ?
gah, the file size doesn't even show up. In which case you'd want to fsck it first.
So basically it is a corrupt file?
I can't speak for sure. But most likely so.
Thanks for your help and also everyone else :)
